file_content.text: I hope you've found some more information on this ghost business, Andronikos.
Look, I've been doing some digging around, and by all accounts, this stuff is more messed up than Tatooine.
Pirates run this place, though the Empire and the Republic have dared to move in of late. Still, ships don't land here.
The cold is part of it, but there are other rumors. The kind you'd ignore if you had sense.
Fortunately, I'm not interested in sense, only ghosts. What do these rumors say?
Rumors tend to hide truth.
Great. You brought me here to chase rumors.
You're no help.
Truth often dwells in hidden places, my little master.
There's nothing sensible about looking for a ghost in a frozen wasteland.
I abandoned sense long ago.
Yeah, I guess if I wanted sense I should've stuck with killing and stealing.
There was a light freighter out of Yavin Four, the Starrunner, disappeared over this place. Reported some strange happenings before it did.
It was a smuggler vessel, loaded full of ancient junk from Yavin's tombs. If I wanted to catch a ghost, I'd start asking after that ship.
Hope you've got your blasters ready.
Let's go, Andronikos.
Just finishing the cold-weather fittings, and I'll be ready.
This looks like an excellent opportunity to continue your training, Ashara.
Apprentice, follow me.
I'm ready, master.
Do you know where this ship went down?
Any ideas where it crashed?
The ether's cloudy around that point.
Thank you, Andronikos. Khem Val? Or is it Zash? Let's go.
Dashade, come with me.
The she-serpent is under the rock. I am myself for the moment and ready, as ever, to follow.
Holo chatter says the Empire's operating on this ice block. So, you might try using your new Lord-of-the-Sith authority.
Careful though, place is crawling with pirates, and they aren't all as nice as me.
